intro: Philotheca verrucosa, commonly known as the rough-leaved philotheca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub with small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are often covered in small, raised bumps, giving them a rough texture. Philotheca verrucosa is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
